column5: First of all im stating this now in the beginning of the the post.... i will not tell anyone where i fished. This is because i went out on my own time with my friends and put in our leg work to find these fish, and i feel everyone should do the same. Anyways just ENJOY the pics....   Ho ho's for days            some chinney love, one and only fish to bite the dust this year..      So i start working again tomorow after a two and half weeks off, everyone have a safe a fun salmon season!
Stellar early season tribbin' lads! well done.  You put your legwork in and it paid off!  How was the elbow-room on those drifts? lol  Tony
Yeah, I'm with you, let the Gatorade flow! That was a pretty negative way to start a thread but thanks for the great pics. You did really well.
Nice work. Wish i wasn't working overtime this week!

haha i guess it was kinda negative... i just didnt want a full inbox of "where did you go fishing" or  "hey your my friend right?" msgs... i felt like it was a valid point to put out. thanks for the comments! the early bird gets the first worm!
Hate hate hate hate hate.....   Nice fishin!!!  CHeers,  PMack
Very cool fish  pics. What program did you use to make the swirls?
that looks like a really sweet mixed bag there...thanks for the pics to get us drooling   Are you above at least sharing with us what the hot tactic was?
You can tell me where you caught those fish... I promise I won't tell anybody else!
Nice work guys!!  I hope to do some violating of my own this sat...   Photoshop!!    cheers HD

ok thanks, I suspected that was the culprit. I might have need of  it soon for muskie fishing.  I'd ask my buddy in Forensics to see if he can "unswirl" those pics above of the fish. lol j/k hmmm... " If you can postulate the degree of the swirl effect used. Entering the exact negative amount will yield and "un-swirled" picture as if it were new but slightly pixilated."
Looks more like the "Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds" program to me.
Some good looking ones in those pics!!! Congrats Leechman
Yeah the skies do seem a bit marmalade!  Am I giving you flashbacks dawg??!

actually if u just upload your pics through photobucket and click the edit button there is an option to let u blurr out objects or in this case backgrounds! && secret tactic was float fishing with bright coloured flies and roe

Lol, how do I ask the guy where he caught the fish now?  If it's not the river I know still has a run of coho it would be good info for egg collection later on.  No really, it's for the greater good of the resource, really really!
All of that work just to take the steeples out of the backround...... Nice fish wish we had them down here in Virginia  Art
